author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: وَسُفَرائُكَ، أَيْ رَبِّ أَسْئَلُكَ بِاسْمِكَ الَّذِيْ جَعَلْتَهُ مَطْلَعَ أَمْرِكَ وَمَشْرِقَ إِلْهامِكَ بِأَنْ تُقَدِّرَ لِهذا المَظْلُومِ وَأَحِبَّتِكَ ما يَنْبَغِي لِحَضْرَتِكَ، إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ المُعْطِي المُقْتَدِرُ العَلِيمُ الحَكِيمُ.
translation: I beseech Thee, O my Lord, by Thy Name which Thou hast made to be the Dayspring of Thy Revelation and the Dawning-Place of Thine inspiration, to ordain for this wronged One and for them that are dear to Thee what becometh Thy loftiness. Thou, in very truth, art the All-Bountiful, the All-Powerful, the All-Knowing, the All-Wise.
